title: What is the average range of response time for the District Court of Southern California to rule on a matter?
question: What is the average range of response time for the District Court of Southern California to rule for an appeal of a Bankruptcy Court order after all the parties have filed their responses?
answers: Unfortunately, most courts including bankruptcy courts are backlogged with cases due in part to those that have been continued because of the novel coronavirus. It would be very difficult to give even a range or estimate right now on when they may rule on an appeal order.

In the best of times, the time to receive a ruling is all but impossible to determine because so much of the process is wholly within the discretion of the court. the level and amount of cases pending, availability of law clerks needed to research issues, the list goes on and on. Add to the mix fewer people reporting to work and the bottom line is: no one knows.
These days with this crisis.....?????? impossible to say
